statements.description: ვ is usually added at the beginning of the word to indicate the first person.
Usually there is no indicator for the second person.
ს is added in the end of the word to indicate the third person.
Plural verbs are ended with თ letter
But in 3rd person ending is ენ
The most common and neutral word order is Subject-Object-Verb
The word before a monosyllabic word can take a so-called emphatic vowel 'a'
ქონა is used for inanimate objects
statements.example: მე მაქვს ჩანთა [I have a bag]

statements.description: ყოლა is used for animate objects
statements.example: მე მყავს მეგობარი [I have a friend]

statements.description: Nominative case is used to express a subject or an object.
Ergative case is used to express subject actions that were in the past.
Dative case.
Genitive - the case of a possessor.
Instrumental case.
Adverbial case is used for forming adverbs or when something is being transformed into something else.
Vocative case is used as a form of address to a person (or thing).
კო suffix is used to express that something is small or cute
Construction სა{noun}ე|ო|ურ|- is used to form a word that denotes the purpose, function, appointment.
statements.example:
ყური [ear] -> საყურე [earring]
ქვეყანა [country] -> საქვეყნო [public]
ფეხი [foot] -> საფეხური [step]

statements.description: Construction სა{verb}ელ|არ|ულ|ო|ალ|- forms a noun for what this verb is used
statements.example:
წერა [write] -> საწერი [something that shall be written]
კეთება [do] -> საკეთებელი [something that shall be done]
ხვეწნა [beg] -> სახვეწარი [something to beg for]
წყვა [measure] -> საწყაული [something to measure with]
რჩენა [save, support] -> სარჩო [means of subsistence]
მკა [reap] -> სამკალი [harvest]

statements.description: Construction {noun}ელ is used to create adjective from nouns denoting the place.
Construction {noun}იან is used to create adjective that indicates possession from noun.
Construction უ{noun}ო is used to denote the lack of something.
Construction სი{adjective}ე is used to create abstract noun from the adjective.
